dcterms:creator: R. Selten
dcterms:description: Selten's Chain-Store Paradox is a game that illustrates the paradoxical outcomes that can arise in game theory when players' beliefs are not constrained. It highlights the importance of beliefs in determining optimal strategies.
dcterms:title: Seltenâ€™s Chain-Store Paradox

dcterms:description: Experimental games (G1, G2, G3, g1, g2, g3, g4, g5, g6, g7, g8, g9, g10) are various setups used in experiments to analyze player behavior and decision-making in strategic situations.
dcterms:title: Experimental Games

dcterms:creator: U. Fischbacher
dcterms:description: z-Tree is a software tool used for conducting economic experiments, allowing researchers to create and run experiments in a controlled environment.
dcterms:title: z-Tree

dcterms:creator: T. Hossain
R. Okui
dcterms:description: The Binarized Scoring Rule (BSR) is a method used for incentivizing belief elicitation in experiments, allowing participants to earn rewards based on their predictions.
dcterms:title: Binarized Scoring Rule (BSR)

dcterms:creator: R. D. McKelvey
T. R. Palfrey
dcterms:description: Quantal Response Equilibrium (QRE) is a solution concept in game theory that allows for mistakes in player choices, providing a probabilistic model of decision-making.
dcterms:title: Quantal Response Equilibrium (QRE)

dcterms:creator: D. O. Stahl
P. W. Wilson
dcterms:description: Level-k model datasets are used to analyze players' strategic thinking and sophistication levels in games, providing insights into how players model the behavior of others.
dcterms:title: Level-k Model Datasets
